original: Bäärnhielm, Gösta, borgmästare, Göteborg, f. 6/9/90 i Sthlm av här:-hövd. Mauritz B. o. Louise Arhusi-ander. G. 19 m. Eira Lagerlöf, d. 40. Barn: Mauritz f. 21, Carl-Gösta 23, Ingmar 25, d. 27, Christina 36. –Stud:ex. v. Gbgs latin 09, jur. kand. i Upps. 14. Stud:res. t. Danm. m. stat. domarstip. f. stud. av det nya rätteg :-förfar. 21. E. o. not. i Svea o. Göta hovr. 14, tingstjg. 14-16, tjg. s. e. not. i Svea hovr. vårsess. 17, kanslist i lagutsk. 17, aman. h. Sv:es redarefören. i Gbg 17, e. not. i Gbgs rådhusr. 18, assessor 23, rådman 35, tf. borgmäst. i Gbg 39, borgmäst, där sed. 44. Ombudsm. h. Gbgs barnav:byrå 18-19, dispaschörs-assist. 20-31, andre ombudsm. h. Älvsb. m. fl. 1. hyp:fören. sed. 26, sekr. i fören. Sv:es stadsdomare 27-29, led. av styr. sed. 38, sakk. i just:dep. ang. lagstiftn. om fri rättegång 41. Skr.: Anteckn. om d. allm. tviste- o. brottmålsförfar. i Danm. efter Retsrefor-men (22), Rättegången i brottmål (23, m. rätt. o. tillägg 25, 2. uppl. 27), Ut-omäktenskapl. barns ställn. (34) samt art. i facktidskr., bl. a. Sv. Juristtidn. RNO 43. Böhme-Jænson, Jan Gustav, distriktsveterinär, Mörbylånga, f. 30/11/ 08 i Locknevi, Kalm. 1., av Artur Jæn-son o. Sigrid Jænson-Tisell, f. Böhme. G. 40 m. Anne-Margret Sjöholm. Barn: Ursula f. 41, Mats 43, Eva 46. — Veter:ex. 33. Stud:resa i Ung., Tyskl. 38. Distr:- o. länsveter :tj. 33-43, distr :veter. i Mörbylånga fr. 43. Medl. av SHT.
translated:
Bäärnhielm, Gösta, mayor of Gothenburg, born on 6/9/90 in Stockholm to Colonel Maurice B. and Louise Arhusiander. Married Eira Lagerlöf in 1919, who died in 1940. Children: Mauritz (born 1921), Carl-Gösta (1923), Ingmar (1925-1927), Christina (1936). He passed his secondary school exams at Gothenburg Latin School in 1909 and his law degree at Uppsala University in 1914. He had a study trip to Denmark with a state judicial scholarship for the study of the new legal proceedings in 1921. He was a junior clerk and then a notary public at the Supreme Court and Gothenburg Court from 1914-1917. He was a clerk in the legislative committee in 1917, an assistant to the Swedish Shipowners' Association in Gothenburg in 1917, a notary public at Gothenburg City Court from 1918, a judge in 1923, a magistrate in 1935, an acting mayor in Gothenburg in 1939, and mayor there from 1944. He was also an ombudsman at Gothenburg's child welfare agency (1918-1919), a dispatch assistant (1920-1931), and a second ombudsman at Älvsborg and others in the first mortgage association since 1926. He was secretary of the Association of Swedish Municipal Judges from 1927-1929 and a member of the board since 1938. He was an expert in the Ministry of Justice regarding legislation on free trials in 1941. He wrote "Notes on General Disputes and Criminal Procedures in Denmark after Retsreformen" (1922), "Criminal Proceedings" (1923, with corrections and additions in 1925 and a second edition in 1927), and "The Position of Out of Wedlock Children" (1934) as well as articles in professional journals such as "Swedish Juristtidn" and received the title of RNO in 1943.

Böhme-Jænson, Jan Gustav, district veterinarian in Mörbylånga. Born on 30/11/08 in Locknevi, Kalmar County. His parents were Artur Jænson and Sigrid Jænson-Tisell, née Böhme. He married Anne-Margret Sjöholm in 1940. Children: Ursula (born 1941), Mats (1943) and Eva (1946). He passed his veterinary exam in 1933. He had a study trip to Hungary and Germany in 1938. He served as a district and county veterinarian from 1933-1943 and as a district veterinarian in Mörbylånga since 1943. He is a member of the Swedish Veterinary Association (SHT).

structured.name: Gösta Bäärnhielm
structured.description: Gösta Bäärnhielm was born on June 9, 1890, in Stockholm. He passed his secondary school exams at Gothenburg Latin School in 1909 and his law degree at Uppsala University in 1914. He served as a junior clerk and then a notary public at the Supreme Court and Gothenburg Court from 1914-1917. He was a clerk in the legislative committee in 1917, an assistant to the Swedish Shipowners' Association in Gothenburg in 1917, a notary public at Gothenburg City Court from 1918, a judge in 1923, a magistrate in 1935, an acting mayor in Gothenburg in 1939, and mayor there from 1944. He was also an ombudsman and a dispatch assistant, among other roles. In 1941, he became an expert in the Ministry of Justice regarding legislation on free trials. His published works include 'Notes on General Disputes and Criminal Procedures in Denmark after Retsreformen' (1922), 'Criminal Proceedings' (1923, with corrections and additions in 1925 and a second edition in 1927), and 'The Position of Out of Wedlock Children' (1934), as well as articles in professional journals such as 'Swedish Juristtidn'. Gösta Bäärnhielm was married to Eira Lagerlöf, who died in 1940. They had four children: Mauritz, Carl-Gösta, Ingmar (who passed away), and Christina. He later married Anne-Margret Sjöholm, with whom he had three children: Ursula, Mats, and Eva. Jan Gustav Böhme-Jænson, a district veterinarian in Mörbylånga, was born on November 30, 1908, in Locknevi, Kalmar County, to Artur Jænson and Sigrid Jænson-Tisell, née Böhme. He married Anne-Margret Sjöholm in 1940. They had three children: Ursula, Mats, and Eva. Jan Böhme-Jænson passed his veterinary exam in 1933 and had a study trip to Hungary and Germany in 1938. He served as a district and county veterinarian from 1933-1943 and as a district veterinarian in Mörbylånga since 1943. He is a member of the Swedish Veterinary Association (SHT).
